trans-unit.source: Represents the <xref uid="langword_csharp_<cookieHandler>" name="<cookieHandler>" href=""></xref> configuration element.

The `<cookieHandler>` element is a child element of the `<federatedAuthentication>` element; the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederatedAuthenticationElement.CookieHandler%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is set to an instance of the CookieHandlerElement class.

The `<cookieHandler>` element is used to configure the cookie handler used by the Session Authentication Module (SAM), which is represented by the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule> class.

A cookie handler can be configured in one of the following ways: - To configure a chunked cookie handler, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property to either <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode> and set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property with the configuration element for your chunked cookie handler.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property should not be set.

- To configure a chunked cookie handler with the default chunk size, you can set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property as mentioned earlier, but leave both the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> and the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> properties unset.

- To configure a custom cookie handler, set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode> and set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property with the configuration element that identifies the type of your custom cookie handler.
This type must derive from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandler> class.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property should not be set.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement"></xref> class.
Gets or sets a chunked cookie handler.
This property is equivalent to the `<chunkedCookieHandler>` child element of the `<cookieHandler>` element.
It specifies a chunked cookie handler, an instance of the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandler> class, to use.

If it is set, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property should be set to either <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode> or <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode>.

If the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property is set to either of these values but the ChunkedCookieHandler property is not set, a chunked cookie handler with the default chunk size (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandler.DefaultChunkSize?displayProperty=fullName>) is configured.
Either the ChunkedCookieHandler property or the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.CustomCookieHandler%2A> property may be set, but not both.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandlerElement"></xref> that provides additional configuration for the chunked cookie handler.
Gets or sets a custom cookie handler type.
This property must be set when a custom cookie handler is being configured.
This property is equivalent to the `<customCookieHandler>` child element of the `<cookieHandler>` element.
It specifies a custom cookie handler type to use.
If this property is set, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.Mode%2A> property must be set to <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode>.
The custom type specified by this property must be derived from the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandler> class.
Either the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement.ChunkedCookieHandler%2A> property or the CustomCookieHandler property may be set, but not both.
A <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Configuration.CustomTypeElement"></xref> that defines the custom cookie handler type.
Gets or sets the domain value for cookies written by the handler.
Represents the `domain` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](../Topic/%3CcookieHandler%3E.md) element.
The domain value.
The default is an empty string.
Gets a new cookie handler based on the configuration properties.
This method returns a cookie handler that is consistent with the configuration.
The cookie handler returned will be either a chunked cookie handler or a custom cookie handler depending on how the configuration properties are set.
For more information, see <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerElement>.
The cookie handler.

This will be an instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandler"></xref> or <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.ChunkedCookieHandler"></xref> depending on the kind of handler that is configured by the properties of the current instance.
A cookie handler cannot be created from the properties of the current instance.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the <xref uid="langword_csharp_httpOnly" name="httpOnly" href=""></xref> property of the cookies written by this handler should be set.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref uid="langword_csharp_httpOnly" name="httpOnly" href=""></xref> property should be set; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
Gets or sets the cookie handler mode.
A valid <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode"></xref> value that indicates the kind of cookie handler that is being configured.
The default value is <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Services.CookieHandlerMode"></xref>, which indicates a chunked cookie handler.
Gets or sets the base name for any cookies written by the handler.
Represents the `name` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](../Topic/%3CcookieHandler%3E.md) element.
The base name for the cookies.
The default is “FedAuth”.
Gets or sets the path value for cookies written by the handler.
A string that contains the path.
Gets or sets the lifetime of cookies issued by the handler.
Represents the `persistentSessionLifetime` attribute of the [\<cookieHandler\>](../Topic/%3CcookieHandler%3E.md) element.
A <xref:System.TimeSpan> that represents the cookie lifetime.
The default is 0 days (“0.0:0:0”).
The value must be a value between 0 (“0.0:0:0”) and 365 (“365.0:0:0”) days.
Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the cookie should be used only with SSL.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the cookie should only be used over an SSL connection; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref>.
